content: {{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-086-01-A |Item_parent=Eyelid pathology |Item_parent_short=Eyelid pathology |Rank=A |Title=Recognising an ectropion and its complications |Description=None |Rubric=Positive diagnosis |Contributors= |Order=1}} '''Ectropion:''' outward slackening of the eyelid, due to relaxation of the cutaneous tissues, retraction of the tissues or muscular relaxation. '''Complications:''' corneal exposure, lacrimation (tilting of the lower lacrimal point), inadequate palpebral occlusion.

question.title: What is a common complication of ectropion?

option_a.title: Corneal ulcers
option_a.description: A condition where the cornea is damaged, often due to a lack of lubrication

option_c.title: Inadequate palpebral occlusion
option_c.description: A condition where the eyelids do not close properly

option_d.title: Corneal exposure
option_d.description: A condition where the cornea is exposed to the environment

correct_option.title: A
correct_option.description: The correct letter of the correct option
